name: Harvey's Point

reviews.text: Best hotel ever!!!! A must stay. You won't regret it. We actually stayed in december '11 but its taken me a while to write this. Fabulous and luxurious!! Food was delicious. Staff were extremely nice. Rooms were so comfortable, immaculate and well kept.
reviews.title: Top class

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed in this hotel for 1 night as a special treat. We stayed in an executive room with our dog in the main part of the hotel. We stayed for bed and breakfast and a four course meal in the lake view restaurant. Service in the restaurant was excellent, food amazing and breakfast was unbelievable! My husband and I didn't need anything to eat until the evening we had such a big breakfast.
reviews.title: A most enjoyable stay

reviews.text: The staff were all very pleasant and helpful. The room was beautiful, we just wish we had had more than one night to really enjoy it. The dog was made very welcome and she did not effect the standard of the room we were given. Before we left, we were given a tour of the hotel and the dog was welcome to come with us. We really loved the lake house rooms. These have got very bad reviews and it put us of staying in them. For this reason I wanted to see what these rooms were like. They were newly refurbished and although slightly smaller, had all the same conveniences as the executive room. They have lovely private balconies overlooking the lake and my husband decided that if we ever go to stay again,he would like to stay in one of those!
reviews.title: Excellent As Always

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would highly recommend this hotel to everyone, the location is idyllic and the panoramic views of the lake and mountains is wonderful, definitely the nicest hotel I have ever stayed in.
reviews.title: Definately Somewhere Over the Rainbow

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This this the end of our 4th visit to Harvey's Point and again no disappointment.
reviews.title: A 5*star hotel with a 4* rating

reviews.text: We have visited Harveys Point on a number of occasions and once again enjoyed the whole experience - the attention to detail and friendliness of staff set it apart we hope to visit again soon , each time we return it improves !
reviews.title: enjoyable return

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just back from our first ever trip to Harvey's Point today and I had to share our experience. Our stay was wonderful; this was a couple of nights away as a kind of mini honeymoon and we were treated like royalty throughout our entire stay. In fact, Sean kept calling me a princess as he took our bags to our penthouse suite!!! Luxurious doesn't begin to describe it. Also, although the hotel was busy judging by the people there for breakfast, when we were in our room we could have been in the hotel alone; it was so quiet and peaceful. We had our dinner in the hotel on our first night there and it was absolutely delicious :) There is everything you could possibly want for breakfast including freshly made omelettes or pancakes with either maple syrup, golden syrup, honey, or grand marnier (!) - I can't think of anything for breakfast that wasn't available... The location is breathtaking and even though it rained a lot we managed to get out for a lovely walk and take some beautiful photos beside the Lough. We will definitely be back; and I don't think we'll be able to wait until our first anniversary to indulge ourselves again.
reviews.title: Amazing stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Last week we went back tot Harveys Point on the Shores of Lough Eske county Donegal. It was our eight visit in five years. We brought the parents of my wife with us this time. They wanted to see if all our stories about Harveys Point were true. They were as amazed as we were the first time we visited this hotel. Everything was perfect. The room, the food and the warm hospitality. This is definitely a first class hotel. We stayed for four nights this time in a Premier Suite of 87m2 with a stunning lake view. It was all too short!
reviews.title: You have to come back to Harveys Point!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Definitely coming back next year!
reviews.title: Luxary hotel, beautiful location, large rooms, great chef

reviews.text: Situated on a lake the hotel grounds enjoy beautiful scenery. We booked executive king room which was both enormous and very comfortable with a huge bathroom and soaking tub. Dinner was fabulous as was the attentive staff. Somewhat pricey overall but worth the visit and we'd go again. Our only negative was the hotel was busy that weekend so the breakfast service was somewhat chaotic.
reviews.title: Harvey's Point hotel truly is the best hotel in Ireland!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Absolutely perfect view from lough side suite. Suite itself was amazing - had to warn my husband he could not move in permanently. But details count in a hotel like this and perhaps because it was November we did not feel the service was always seamless. It began with no porter - bit of a surprise. We were there for two nights and the suite was not tidied although a nice man came with cookies and fresh milk. First morning at breakfast my husbands poached eggs - he is a form of torture with his insistence on poached eggs - did not arrive until he was finished his breakfast and then had just been flung on the plate. Second morning hurray beautifully presented poached eggs arrived. On the first night we ate in the bar and enjoyed the food and the service. 2nd night in the restaurant the relaxed attitude became too relaxed to the extent that he was becoming cross and thought we were being ignored. Things improved when our order was finally taken and we enjoyed the food. An early checkout at 11 means second morning feels a little bit rushed but maybe we were just reluctant to leave the luxury of the suite.
reviews.title: 10 stars for the suite and the view.

reviews.text: Harveys Point does not have a swimming pool or a spa and I think that makes it important that people are given information on what is available within the hotel. We did not receive any information at reception so were expecting it to be in the room and it was not. However we had a beautiful walk and watching the swans is just lovely. We then accidentally discovered a lovely reading room but did not have time to use it. You have to come outside to access the hotel from the lough view rooms but although we had to wrap up we felt it was worth it. We also very much appreciated being able to control the heat in the rooms ourselves.
reviews.title: Nice experience in an exquisite hotel

reviews.text: We had a nice time and the winner of the biggest suite with the most stunning view was definitely Harveys Point.
reviews.title: Truly wonderful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here with my partner and really enjoyed it. The location of the hotel is just fantastic and it is so relaxing. There was a wedding reception taking place on the day we arrived but we didn't even notice as the hotel is very big. Our room was amazing equipped with a jacuzzi and kitchenette. The bed was huge and very comfortable. The bathroom was huge also. Basically I would have stayed in the room all day it was gorgeous. The staff were all very friendly at reception although the bar/restaurant staff could have been a bit more talkative with guests. We had dinner in the bar the bread basket starter was very nice but the tortellini we had for main was course was more like a kids portion.
reviews.title: OK

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Would recommend this hotel for a weekend getaway and would definitely recommend using the jacuzzi :)
reviews.title: Fabulous

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have stayed here a few times now and each time just makes me want to come back again. I find it totally relaxing, beautiful scenic views over the lough while dining. Extremely helpful and pleasant staff. Spacious and spotlessly clean rooms. My personal rating for Harvey's Point is 10 out of 10. Well Done again Harvey's, See you in the near future. Cant Wait.
reviews.title: A Taste Of Excellence

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: G Nelson.
reviews.title: Unforgettable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Deirdre and Staff, thank you for making our recent short break perfect. We stayed two nights, enjoyed evening meals. The warm/friendly genuine greetings throughout our stay was infectious, resulting in all guests doing similar. Food must be experienced, words fail to describe. Rooms spacious, warm, décor/furniture make the stay a home from home. For outdoor pursuits be it a leisurely walks (on the grounds of the hotel), hill walking (starts at the gate), nearby golf or a walk on the beach, within a 10 minute drive, everyone should experience this resort, we will return soon.
reviews.title: A wonderful place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is without a doubt the best Hotel we've ever stayed in. The peacefulness and tranquility of the setting makes it the perfect place for rest and relaxation. It would be easy to imagine you are the only person in the building - It is so quiet. There is no background music in the corridors or breakfast room either. I loved that sense of 'getting away from it all'.
reviews.title: Amazing as usual
Brian G "A Hidden Gem"
reviews.text: I was completely shocked at the spaciousness and luxury of the 'basic' executive room. Anything that you could possibly need was available. The staff were extremely welcoming and helpful and willing to do anything to make our stay special. This was our first experience of Harvey's Point, but it will definitely not be our last!

description: There is an air of Romance at Harvey's Point, set in the mystical, magical shadow of the Blue Stack Mountains on the shores of Lough Eske. Owned and managed by the Swiss Family Gysling since it opened in 1989, Harvey's Point has developed into the leading destination hotel of the northwest, specialising in top class accommodation, exquisite cuisine and genuine Irish hospitality. Harvey's Point is the recipient of the prestigious AA Hotel of the Year award 2007 / 2008.
